page.title: 09Bridgnorth Smithfield Market
page.content: The Bridgnorth Smithfield Market is held every Monday and Thursday on a site at the bottom end of Whitburn Street. the owners, Nock Deighton, auction sheep, cattle, pigs and vegetables. They sell garden produce and small animals such as rabbits, goats and also poultry. The Cattle Market is very close to St. John's School and Bridgnorth Infirmary, and you can often hear the noise of the cattle on market days. Farmers come from all over Shropshire to sell or buy produce and farm animals. On the same site, a Play-Group is run by the wife of Mr. David Deighton. Farmers wives sell cheese and butter which they have made themselves and also eggs from the poultry they keep. The Smithfield Cattle Market is open to the public and there is no admission charge.
